page.title: 05The Scrap Yard, Snailwell
page.content: {Mayer Newman}buy, process and sell different grades of scrap metal to steelmakers in Britain and abroad.They have 3 main ways of producing the scrap. Light iron from cookers, bicycles and cars is shredded into pieces.Heavy steel from farm machinery and construction girders are cut into smaller pieces by huge hydraulic shears. They have a special machine called a{Burning Tunnel}which is for railway carriages which contain poisonous blue asbestos linings. All the smoke, fumes and debris are trapped in the machine, then sealed and disposed of at a special tip. All the scrap is then weighed and sold. It is despatched by lorry. If it is being sent to Europe and Scandinavia, it is transported by boat from Norwich through the local port of Great Yarmouth.
